text: Økonomisk Rapport (English: Financial Report) was a monthly business magazine published in Oslo, Norway. The magazine was in circulation between 1974 and January 2013. ==History and profile== The magazine was founded in 1974. Previously owned by Fora Medier, the magazine was based in Oslo. Although it was not originally started as a business publication, when it was bought by Hjemmet Mortensen, the magazine was redesigned as a business-oriented publication. In 2002 Hjemmet Mortensen sold the magazine to a group of investors. In 2006 Media House Vårt Land or Mentor Media came in as a major shareholder of the magazine. Ivar Hippe was the editor-in-chief of the magazine from 1999 to 2002. Another editor-in-chief was Terje Aurdal. At the beginning of 2013 the magazine together with its sister publications Kultmag and Mandag Morgen was sold by Mentor Media to Magne Lerø. In late January 2013 Magne Lerø announced that the magazine would be closed. The magazine had a circulation of 24,946 copies in 2000 and 24,000 copies in 2002. ==References== ==External links== * Official site * World Cat info Category:1974 establishments in Norway Category:2013 disestablishments in Norway Category:Business magazines published in Norway Category:Defunct magazines published in Norway Category:Magazines established in 1974 Category:Magazines disestablished in 2013 Category:Magazines published in Oslo Category:Norwegian-language magazines Category:Weekly magazines published in Norway
title: Økonomisk Rapport
